description: Ready to use that fancy new /b/workbench/b/?
Put a /b/vanilla tool/b/ into it. You can /6/swap out parts/6/ for diffrent types or /6/new materials/6/.
Try it out, swap out a tool part.
The /b/Holosphere/b/ documents /6/every material and it's stats/6/. It also shows you how /6/material stats transfer into tool module/6/ stats.

For example, a /b/Sword Blade/b/'s Damage increases depending on the /b/Hardness/b/ of the input material. A /b/Bow Stave's/b/ /6/Draw Strength and Speed/6/ increases with /b/Flexibility/b/, but /b/Hardness/b/ more signifigantly increases /6/Draw Strength but reduces Draw Speed/6/. You can /6/view what stats transfer/6/ by /6/hovering over icons/6/ next to the /b/material input slot/b/.
You may require /6/addtional tools/6/ to apply parts. /b/Iron/b/ requires a /b/level 2 (stone) Hammer/b/ for example. Make sure you have the required tools for tinkering.
